snippet: While Brig. Gen. Manaf Tlass drew world attention when he fled on Thursday, President Bashar al-Assad’s bigger military challenge is the swelling number of silent objectors in Syria.
abstract: Defection of Brig Gen Manaf Tlass, who was close to Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria, has provided the most telling sign yet of eroding support for his government among even the most elite and trusted Sunni Muslims, who serve as a critical pillar of the security forces and civilian administration; Assad’s bigger military challenge, however, is the swelling number of silent objectors, soldiers of all ranks lacking the means to flee, or the interest, but no longer cooperating with the government.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Dalal Mawad from Beirut, Dan Bilefsky from Paris, Alan Cowell from London and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: While Brig. Gen. Manaf Tlass drew world attention when he fled on Thursday, President Bashar al-Assad’s bigger military challenge is the swelling number of silent objectors in Syria.

headline.seo: France Confirms Top Syrian General’s Defection
headline.main: Syrian’s Defection Signals Eroding Support for Assad
headline.print_headline: Defections Add New Pressures Against Assad

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
